cards.name: Alakazam

pokemonPower.name: Damage Swap
pokemonPower.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

cards.name: Blastoise

pokemonPower.name: Rain Dance
pokemonPower.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 1 Water Energy card to 1 of your Water Pokémon. (This doesn't use up your 1 Energy card attachment for the turn.) This power can't be used if Blastoise is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high-speed tackles.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

cards.name: Chansey
cards.text: A rare and elusive Pokémon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to catch it.

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Chansey during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Chansey does 80 damage to itself.

cards.name: Charizard

pokemonPower.name: Energy Burn
pokemonPower.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard in order to use this attack.

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokemon is, Clefairy's type is still Colorless.)

cards.name: Gyarados
cards.text: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Hitmonchan
cards.text: While seeming to do nothing, it fires punches in lightning-fast volleys that are impossible to see.

cards.name: Machamp

pokemonPower.name: Strikes Back
pokemonPower.text: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Machamp (even if Machamp is Knocked Out), this power does 10 damage to the attacking Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power can't be used if Machamp is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when your opponent attacks.

cards.text: Using its amazing muscles, it throws powerful punches that can knock its victim clear over the horizon.

cards.name: Magneton
cards.text: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. It frequently appears when sunspots flare up.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 80 damage to itself.

cards.name: Mewtwo
cards.text: A scientist created this Pokemon after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA-engineering experiments.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Barrier
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Mewtwo in order to use this attack. During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mewtwo.

cards.name: Nidoking
cards.text: Uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break its prey's bones.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Nidoking does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

cards.name: Ninetales
cards.text: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokemon.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Ninetales in order to use this attack.

cards.name: Poliwrath
cards.text: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwrath but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokemon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

cards.name: Raichu
cards.text: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Raichu.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raichu does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Venusaur

pokemonPower.name: Energy Trans
pokemonPower.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

attacks.name: Solarbeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Zapdos
cards.text: A legendary bird Pokemon that is said to appear from clouds while wielding enormous lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos in order to use this attack.

cards.name: Beedrill
cards.text: Flies at high speed and attacks using the large, venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Dragonair
cards.text: A mystical Pokemon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

cards.name: Dugtrio
cards.text: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Electrode

pokemonPower.name: Buzzap
pokemonPower.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it to 1 of your other Pokemon. If you do, choose a type of Energy. Electrode is now an Energy card (instead of a Pokemon) that provides 2 energy of that type. this power can't be used if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.text: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

attacks.name: Electric Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrode does 10 damage to itself.
